intro: Nauclea monocephala, commonly known as the single-headed nauclea, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its erect, often branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly pubescent surface. Its flowers are small and clustered in racemes, typically with white or pale pink petals. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds.
